website_summaries.verdict: An affordable tool that's ideal for the hobbyist jewelry maker or metal crafts maker; but it's not as versatile or sturdy as other options on our list.
pros: Designed to punch holes in different types of sheet metal up to 18 gauge
Handles have a comfortable shape for a comfortable grip
cons: Not sturdy enough for thick or industrial materials
Pin tends to wear out with frequent use
May leave a mark on metal after punching a hole

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pliers and they do a great job of punching through metal. I used them on nickle and sterling blanks to make pendants and they worked well. It was very easy to punch the metal. The only thing is they do mark the metal slightly. To get around this you can place a piece of card stock in the punch (slide over the metal punch part) to cushion the metal. This way the metal will not get marked.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Smiles

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Wore down the points and broke both bits after attempting to punch a tin sheet metal blank for jewelry. And no return or refund policy. Just a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: Hooligan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for thin silicone rubber...
customer_reviews.text: Euro Tool Metal Hole Punch Pliers, 1.25 Millimeters -- PLR-133.60 This tool doesn't work for thin silicone rubber, which is why I bought it. The cutting pin pushes the rubber through the receiving hole, but when the grips are released, the silicone simply springs back. The problem is, that hole is too big, leaving space for the silicone to squeeze by, so it doesn't actually cut anything. I'll keep it for possible other uses, but for me, it's a dud...
customer_reviews.author: Victor H. Agresti

customer_reviews.title: This tool has saved lots of time over drilling lighter ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool has saved lots of time over drilling lighter gauge sheet metal and hammered wire. It worked well on 30g bronze sheet (half hard), hammered bronze & silver wire up to 18 gauge soft (I did not try 16g soft) , 20g hammered half hard bronze. I tried it on hammered 14g half hard bronze and bent it slightly. I was able to straighten the bit again, but it is not suitable for harder, heavier gauge metals. The 1.8mm punch is a little sturdier, but I would not push it with heavy gauge either.
customer_reviews.author: lchriste

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, bends easily
customer_reviews.text: This piece broke within 2 weeks of getting it. I use thinner gauge metal, but the punch pin bent. I ordered new punch pins, put it in and again the pin bent on a completely different metal. I looked at the punch and saw that the pins and the whole to punch through don’t even line up. Save your money and get a power punch OR buy a screw down punch hole. Better value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool! I was using an awl to punch small holes in my jewelry- or a small drill bit, which always snapped off when I was trying to make tiny holes in metal. Until now...This works really well!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: A Great Little Punch
customer_reviews.text: This is the second I have purchased but only because I cannot find my first one in the mess I call my craft room. Someday I'll find the doorway to the black hole and I will find so many wonderful things that have disappeared. This is a great little punch.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for doing dumb, out of spec things with quick disconnects!
customer_reviews.text: Working on some home arcade stick wire management, and this thing has been perfect for making holes in my disconnects to solder wires to.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use!
customer_reviews.text: I punched a hole in a bottle cap and it worked fine, but when I tried to punch a hole in a metal only slightly thicker it immediately bent. There was a replacement head, but that’s already started bending too and it hasn’t even been that long. Do yourself a favour and get something sturdier even if it is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Alixx S

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Way better than impressart
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought the impressart brand, and they didn't work at all so I figured I would give these a shot. They work great! I had to use all my strength with the impressart brand and I still couldn't punch a hole, but these are very easy to use. I recommend these for sure. They are cheaper and work better than the impressart hole punch.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: You Don't Need a Drill!!
customer_reviews.text: So don't buy one. Get this punch instead. It's wonderful for punching holes in metal wreath decor items and DIDN'T cost me $50 like the drill did. As soon as I got the punch the drill was returned to the store. Thanks Amazon for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this product to make jewelry out of coins but the needle that makes the whole will be completely trashed if you use it on something thicker than a penny ,I did a quarter and it completely destroyed the needle and the backup needle that came with it ,if you're looking for a sturdy whole puncher look elsewhere .
customer_reviews.author: Mariela

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Punched a few holes in 25 gauge copper. Very impressed. On probably fourth or fifth hole found the punch difficult to release from the material. Looked at the punch and cutting head was bent. To replace this tool I'll look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second hole puncher I have purchased. The other style is hard to judge where the hole is positioned. I bought it because I thought it was sturdier, however this one works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: JMZ

customer_reviews.title: I want my money back!!!
customer_reviews.text: This hole punch is terrible quality. I used once. I made three holes then the first pin bent.. I replaced with the second that was included.. I punched five more holes.. this time extremely careful the pin lines up and didn’t loosen before punching.. then pin bent. Of course no returns!! Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Lily1421

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can make my own earring cards. I do wish it could do thicker items. Can only do pretty thin items. If you are wanting to inch a thicker item a deemed might work better.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. I think I messed up the punch a bit cutting stainless steel chain, which was dumb of me. Thankfully they send a spare punch piece! I wouldn't have even known I could get a replacement piece for that, so that's nice. Nice small hole, barely got some 18g wire through it.
customer_reviews.author: JenSweets11

customer_reviews.title: Punches holes in metal cleanly.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my purchase.I had seen a utube tutorial in which the jewelry instructor was using it to punch holes in flattened wire! I ordered one and put it to test.So far so good.I hope it doesn’t break.I had read mixed reviews about this product.There were other less expensive brands but this one looked sturdy so I went ahead and purchased it! A handy tool for wire and metal.
customer_reviews.author: Anin

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: For placing small holes near the edge of whatever you need a hole in, this little gen works beautifully. Much cleaner and easier than a drill. Wish I had bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mabs

customer_reviews.title: Not for anything other than very thin metal
customer_reviews.text: They bent on the second use. Not very strong but I have had my 1.5mm for a very long time with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Harper BC

customer_reviews.title: The hole punch works great! The handles are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The hole punch works great! The handles are very comfortable, but developed a tackiness after a little while. I'm not sure if it was due to how I stored them, or the nature of the handle's material.
customer_reviews.author: rachael gerber

customer_reviews.title: Punch
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for putting the tiny hole in my bottle caps for crafting.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D B

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first day. Both the pin that it came with and the replacement pin. Not at all worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Comes with extras little bits to change out! Easy to use and makes the perfect little hole in metal!
customer_reviews.author: Lahela

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a small hole punch and didn’t realize this was for tin but it works fine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: First time using it and it doesn’t do what it says completely trash. The metal of the hole puncher is so fragile it bends yes it comes with a spare but what’s the use of this thing if it doesn’t punch a hole thru small blank metal.
customer_reviews.author: Yanira

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: My wife likes this tool for her art projects, the tool was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Perez

customer_reviews.title: Steel Nib Broke Off with First Use
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed and can't find a return option. The tool broke by the weak steel nib bending at first use. :( I used thin metal. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A. Trimbath

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It did just what I expected...to punch a hole in metal
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Makes the holes expected in sheet metal for drop ceiling L channel, wish they were bigger, but works!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Ken

customer_reviews.title: It came with an extra bit which is nice.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this metal hole punch in order to install sheet metal screws in my cold air return (to hold the filters in place). Worked very well. Seems to be of high quality. It came with an extra bit which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jay in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say it didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I knew this is meant for thin metal sheet but I took a chance cos no one had tried it on metal tags. Sad to say it didn't work. Hopefully I will find some use for it.
customer_reviews.author: pebbles B

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I love this pliers so much. They make everything so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am just not impressed with this at all. I make key chains and it does not do well punching holes in very thin metal pieces. Would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by the quality of this product. It's a very good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe how long I went without this because I didnt want to spend the money. Instead I was drilling holes in my bottle cap crafts and it was a pain in the kiester! This thing goes thru them like butter! perfect holes, easy, and unbelievable takes hardly any strength. So glad I finally came to my senses and bought this.
customer_reviews.author: keligrl36

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to punch a hole in a beer bottle cap to make a keychain. It worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small hole punch for thin metal components that I am using in jewelry making. These are perfection.
customer_reviews.author: KBell

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good product but the hole it made was smaller than expected
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Works but just okay...
customer_reviews.text: This tool is okay... but it leaves a mark (a ring) around the punched hole. I wouldn't use this on any expensive metals. It's also a little hard to free the punched piece from the tool. If you were using any really thin metals, they'd definitely bend before being released.
customer_reviews.author: catherine

customer_reviews.title: NOT Durable
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what happened to this brand, but I went through both metal punchers (replacement) in 10 minutes. They are NOT durable for jewelry use like it once was. I used my first one for years and the new one is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: grant morris

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Eurotool EuroPunch. It has done exactly what I needed it to do for my jewelry making purposes. I would recommend it to anyone. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Lea Ann Redd

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works punching hole in finger accidentally, warn young user of hazards.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Schneeman

customer_reviews.title: and on a light/thin sheet metal that should be fine with this hole punch
customer_reviews.text: The metal on the punch bent and broke on it's 6th use, and on a light/thin sheet metal that should be fine with this hole punch, it's a metal I use consistently with other punches.
customer_reviews.author: JJean

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't punch a clear hole- the piece that gets punched ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't punch a clear hole- the piece that gets punched doesn't detach all the way and sticks out the side.
customer_reviews.author: Deb S

customer_reviews.title: You need these!
customer_reviews.text: I have been through 3 different metal punchers in a week. These are amazing!!! Effortless punch! No scratches or dents from the tool of the metal. Buy them!!! They work!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Brazziel

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Great. I use it mostly in hammered 16g brass wire. Small enough to make a complete hole once hammered.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: These are ok if your not going to use them often. They worked ok the first few times but left marks that took time to fix and would get stuck often. More of a pain than worth. I've gone back to using a screw down one which works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Three little birds

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to punch holes in bottle caps.
customer_reviews.author: Derbychik03

customer_reviews.title: Great hole punch for metal when making jewelry
customer_reviews.text: bought these to punch holes in metal in repairing or reusing old sterling jewelry. Punched through the metal like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Sirius Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Problem solver at the right price
customer_reviews.text: The right tool at the right price. This baby saves me the trouble of drilling starter holes for piercing metal. I particularly like that one replacement pin is included, and that you can buy additional pins if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lethe

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my punch!
customer_reviews.text: I love this punch. Very easy for up to a penny thickness. I will purchase another in another size. Very satisfied all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: tboombi

customer_reviews.title: It worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this to punch holes through pennies with the years of my husbands, my and our daughter birth years for my mother in law for our wedding. It worked great!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make a hole in my aluminum blank for metal stamping and it worked wonderfully. I was afraid it would take a lot of hand strength, but it doesn't. The hole was a little smaller than I expected, but that was my fault. I was still able to fit my jump ring through the hole.

customer_reviews.title: Multi-purpose tool.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this tool for both jewelry making and on material for projects. It really works well.

customer_reviews.title: IT PUNCHES HOLES IN THIN METAL
customer_reviews.text: ITS A HOLE PUNCHER FOR THIN METAL -- EVEN ON THE THIN METAL SOMETHIMES GETS STUCK BUT NOTHING TO DIFFICULT TO WIGGLE OUT OF -- I DONT SEE THIS WORKING FOR MANY SHEETS OR VERY TOUGH METAL - GOOD FOR ARTS AND CRAFTS

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to find it elsewhere and couldn't find it. Great tool.

customer_reviews.title: Work great, but don't hand to your husband and tell him to squeeze if you can't get the pliers to punch

customer_reviews.text: Does not cut cleanly, leaves burs on copper blanks that need filing and which might cut the wearer. Not recommended.

customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool! Makes holes in thinner metals with ease.

customer_reviews.title: EuroPunch Hole Punch for Metal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, doesn't require a ton of pressure for most things 24GA and thinner. May work fine for thicker; have not yet tried. It's also easy to see where my punch is, which saves a lot of grief of erroneously punching near-but-not-accurate location. I find it's sometimes tough to remove my piece from the punch, and have had better success using the punch with bur-life or some time of wax to lubricate so it comes out easier.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Bottlecaps!
customer_reviews.text: I got mine today and was very impressed at how easy this is to make bottle cap necklaces now. I was doing it a much harder way. I only gave this a 4 because I found the same puncher at JoAnns for $10...but I have decided to keep mine because driving to JoAnns would cost more in gas...but if u have a Joanns near u..get it there..Otherwise I am very happy with this product!!!!

customer_reviews.text: easy to use and very great results, i love it! I recommend it to anyone who is trying to find a good metal puncher to get this one, it's strong and quick to cut through the metal, didn't even need to put much pressure for it to pierce through. :)

product_meta.title: Eurotool EuroPunch 1.25mm Round Hole Punch Pliers for Sheet Metal
product_meta.description: These hole punch pliers will punch copper or silver as thick as 18 gauge. Exactly what you need to easily add a hole to that stamping, metal blank or sheet stock.Will create a clean 1.25mm hole without rough edges or burs in sheet metal stock. The pliers have ergonomic handles and are made of thick carbon steel. One (1) replacement pin included. When worn, the pin can easily be changed for a clean cut every time. Measurements: Pliers are 5 1/4" Long. Punch pin is 1.25mm in diameter and will create 1.25mm round holes. PLEASE NOTE: We highly recommend eye protection with the use of any tools. These pliers are intended for beading and other fine hobby work. Not recommended for heavy duty applications such as automotive, home improvement, or maritime use.
feature_bullets: These hole punch pliers will punch copper or silver as thick as 18 gauge.
Will create a clean 1.25mm hole without rough edges or burs in sheet metal stock.
Measurements: Pliers are 5 1/4" Long. Punch pin is 1.25mm in diameter and will create 1.25mm round holes.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars477 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
